name: Abeer Mohamed Shajahan
role: Computer Science Engineer | Full Stack & ML Enthusiast
intro: I’m a 3rd year B.Tech Computer Science student at Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Technology, passionate about building real-world software systems with strong foundations and beautiful user experiences.
about: I am a 3rd year B.Tech Computer Science and Engineering student at Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Technology, Kottayam. I am deeply interested in building meaningful software solutions and continuously improving myself as a developer and problem solver. My current focus areas are Full Stack Development and Machine Learning. I enjoy understanding systems end-to-end — from database design and APIs to performance, scalability, and real-world constraints. I am currently working on a Complaint Resolver and Asset Management System as a mini project. I have completed a Summer Internship at IBM, gaining exposure to industry practices and collaborative development environments. My long-term goal is to work at leading technology companies such as FAANG and contribute to impactful products.

projects.title: Complaint Resolver & Asset Management System
projects.details: A web-based system designed to streamline complaint handling and asset tracking. Features include complaint registration, status tracking, asset inventory, role-based access, and centralized data storage. Technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Java (planned), MySQL.

projects.title: TCP Chat Application
projects.details: Client–server chat application using TCP sockets enabling real-time communication between multiple clients. Concepts used: TCP/IP, socket programming, blocking I/O.

projects.title: UDP Client–Server Communication
projects.details: Implemented connectionless communication using UDP to explore packet transmission and message handling.
